headline.main: SIXTEEN DAYS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA; ARRIVAL OF THE NORTHERN LIGHT. HIGHLY INTERESTING FROM THE MINES. LATER FROM OREGON. Markets, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the steamship Northern Light, Capt. T. MINER, we are in possession of dates from California to August 1--two weeks later. We are indebted to PURSER N. F. HEDGES and WELLS, FARGO Co's Express Agent, and BERFORD Co., for memoranda and files of papers.

headline.main: SUMMER LETTERS.; CANADA--No. II. Arrival at Montreal--Notices of the City, etc., etc. SARATOGA. OHIO.

NEW-YORK CITY.; Registration of Births, Marriages and Deaths. ARREST UNDER THE ASHBURTON TREATY DEATH FROM IMPROPER TREATMENT ON BOARD AN EMIGRANT SHIP. FATAL ACCIDENT TO AN UNKNOWN MAN. SHOP-LIFTER ARRESTED SAD RESULTS OF INTOXICATION. ACCIDENTAL DEATH MARINE COURT.
BROOKLYN CITY.; BOAT CAPSIZED BODY FOUND A DESPERATE CHARACTER. BURGLARY. ROBBING A TILL ACCIDENTS. STABBING AFFRAY. BURGLARY.

docs.lead_paragraph: MORTALITY.-The Health Officer reports 149 deaths for the week ending August 20-males, 91; males, 58; adults, 71, children. 78.
docs.snippet: MORTALITY.-The Health Officer reports 149 deaths for the week ending August 20-males, 91; males, 58; adults, 71, children. 78.

docs.lead_paragraph: From Mr. CARROL HUGHES, who has just returned home from a trip out on the plains, as far as Sweet Water, about 900 miles out, the St. Joseph's Gazette learns the following facts: That there was an abundance of grass and water. The emigrants were all getting along well, and enjoyed unusual good health, there being less sickness on the plains among emigrants than ever was Known before.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following extracts are from the Bermuda Royal Gazette of the 2d instant: A good deal of excitement has prevailed in the West India Islands subsequent to the receipt of the intelligence of the intention of the Imperial Government to withdraw the troops from the West Indies, and also of the intention of the Government to re duce the Ordnance and Commissariat establishments.

headline.main: SUMMER LETTERS.; Letter-Links between New-York and Virginia. NUMBER FOURTEEN. Red Sulphur Springs Continued--Medical Advice--General Directions--Unprofessional or Non-Professional Opinions.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large part of the invalids who repair to the Red Sulphur Springs are sufferers from disease in the organs of Respiration. The virtue of these waters in such cases has been repeatedly and thoroughly tested, both by ordinary patients and by intelligent physicians, and there can be no doubt whatever, that they are specifically adapted to the alleviation or removal of consumption and its kindred affections.
